name: Meal Kit Service - JTBD Discovery
description: Jobs to Be Done analysis for a meal kit delivery service

inputs.context: Consumer meal kit delivery service competing with Blue Apron, HelloFresh. Market is crowded but churn is high (50%+ annually). Targeting busy professionals who want to cook but struggle with planning and shopping.
inputs.researchData: Customer interviews revealed: 1) Cooking from scratch feels overwhelming after work, 2) Meal planning causes decision fatigue, 3) Grocery shopping wastes time with long lines, 4) Want to eat healthy but takeout is easier, 5) Feel guilty about not cooking 'real meals', 6) Want to impress partners/family with cooking skills, 7) Waste too much money on ingredients that spoil.

mainJobs: Serve home-cooked meals to family without the planning and shopping burden
Feel like a capable cook without extensive culinary skills
Reduce food waste and grocery shopping stress

jobDimensions.functional: Get dinner on the table quickly
jobDimensions.emotional: Feel accomplished and capable as a cook
jobDimensions.social: Be seen as someone who cooks 'real food' for their family

keyForces.strongestPush: Meal planning decision fatigue and grocery shopping time waste
keyForces.strongestPull: Pre-portioned ingredients eliminate waste and decisions
keyForces.biggestAnxiety: Recipes might be too complicated, meals might not taste good
keyForces.strongestHabit: Ordering takeout is instant, no thinking required

jobStories: When I'm leaving work at 6pm, I want to know exactly what I'm making for dinner, so I can avoid the 'what should we eat' discussion
When I'm cooking a new recipe, I want foolproof instructions, so I can feel confident I won't mess it up
When I open my fridge, I want to see exactly what I need for tonight's meal, so I don't waste time searching for ingredients
When family asks 'who cooked this?', I want to proudly say 'I did', so I can feel accomplished
solutions: Foolproof recipes with photos at each step (reduces cooking anxiety)
